quizDescription: Test your wit and cleverness with these intriguing riddles.

questions.question: I have keys but open no locks. I have space but no room. You can enter, but you can't go inside. What am I?
questions.explanation: A keyboard has keys (letters/characters) but doesn't open locks. It has space between keys but no physical room you can enter.

questions.question: What comes once in a minute, twice in a moment, but never in a thousand years?
questions.explanation: The letter 'M' appears once in the word 'minute,' twice in the word 'moment,' but not in 'a thousand years.'

questions.question: I'm tall when I'm young, and I'm short when I'm old. What am I?
questions.explanation: A candle is tall when it's first lit (young) and becomes shorter as it burns (old).

questions.question: I'm not alive, but I can grow. I don't have lungs, but I need air. What am I?
questions.explanation: A fire consumes fuel and 'grows' as it spreads, but it is not a living entity and doesn't have lungs.

questions.question: I'm full of keys but can't open locks. What am I?
questions.explanation: A piano has keys (musical notes) but cannot be used to open locks. It's a musical instrument.

questions.question: The more you take, the more you leave behind. What am I?
questions.explanation: The more steps you take, the more footprints or footsteps you leave behind as you walk.

questions.question: I'm black and white and loved all over the world. What am I?
questions.explanation: Pandas are black and white bears that are popular and loved worldwide.

questions.question: I'm a word of letters three, add two and fewer there will be. What am I?
questions.explanation: The word 'few' has three letters. When you add two letters ('er'), you get 'fewer,' which means a smaller quantity.

questions.question: I'm not alive, but I can die. What am I?
questions.explanation: A battery provides power, but it can 'die' when it runs out of energy. It is not a living thing.

questions.question: I'm a word of letters three, add two and fewer there will be. What am I?
questions.explanation: The word 'few' has three letters. When you add two letters ('er'), you get 'fewer,' which means a smaller quantity.
